title: The past simple tense
description: In dit arrangement komt het Engelse grammaticaonderwerp ''The Simple Past'' aan bod. Met behulp van een kennisclip en oefenopgaven hoop ik hiermee je een beter begrip te geven van het onderwerp.

license.name: CC Naamsvermelding-GelijkDelen 4.0 Internationale licentie

items.content:
Hello and welcome!

Ms. Dina en ik hebben de handen ineen geslagen en hebben voor jullie twee lessenreeksen opgesteld om jullie te helpen het verschil te begrijpen tussen the simple past en the present perfect. Deze worden namelijk vaak door elkaar gehaald. Allereerst ga je aan de slag met het leerarrangement van Ms. Dounia. In haar lessenreeks zal er aandacht worden besteed aan het grammatica onderwerp "the simple past''. Je zal eerst wat uitleg krijgen en daarna krijg je natuurlijk de gelegenheid om te oefenen. Tot slot maak je ook een eindtoets. Doorloop echt elke stap in het proces, op die manier steek je er het meest van op. De bedoeling is natuurlijk dat je na het volgen van dit programma the simple past actief en juist weet te gebruiken.

Heel veel succes!

Alright you guys, it's time to get things started!

De komende week gaan wij op avontuur met Ms. Jane - Zij zal je alles leren over ''the past simple'' tense. Dit betekent dat wanneer je het computerlokaal binnenloopt, je direct aan de computer gaat zitten en aan de slag gaat. Je kan Ms. Jane natuurlijk niet laten wachten. We werken individueel, het programma is zo opgemaakt dat je het heel goed in je eentje moet kunnen volgen. Stel dat je nou echt een dringende vraag hebt, dan steek je je vinger in de lucht en kom ik langs. Hieronder nog even een keer de doelen op een rijtje:

GOALS:

1. Aan het einde van de rit ken je de basisregel van de Simple Past en weet je wanneer je het moet gebruiken.

2. Aan het einde van de rit weet je hoe je de regular verbs moet vormen in de Simple Past

3. Aan het einde van de rit weet je hoe je de irregular verbs moet vormen in de Simple Past

4. Aan het einde van de rit heb je geoefend met het toepassen van de Simple Past middels oefenopgaven en laat je zien het te hebben begrepen in een eindtoets.

So... Are we ready for the ride?

Welcome on planet explanation.

I am mrs. Jane and I heard you needed help with understanding the past simple. It's actually very ''simple'', if you get what I mean ;). I made a video for you in which I am explaining to you everything you need to know about the past simple! I actually had to split it in two due to some technical difficulties, I am sorry for that! Don't forget to make notes so that you might remember en understand things better. After this video you will get the opportunity to practice.

Enjoy!

Yoo and welcome to planet practice!

I hope ms Jane has prepared you well. She was very enthusiastic about you. Let me introduce myself; my name is Marc. And on this planet we're known for helping out each other and practising our grammar very well. We will first do a quick RECAP to the explanation video mrs. Jane made for you. I hope you made some notes and if you didn't; it's okay - I have summarized it a bit for you as well. Are you ready?

LETS GO! :)

Did you know that it has been scientifically proven that if you help someone, you get happier? Crazy right :O. Hieronder vind je een mooi krijtbord waar we met elkaar tips en tricks kunnen delen die we hebben geleerd van mrs Jane - ik heb alvast wat aantekeningen voor jullie gemaakt! Voel je vrij om nog meer tips te delen met je klasgenoten; dit doe je door op het roze knopje rechtsonderin te klikken. Vergeet niet je naam te vermelden bij je aantekening, dat vind ik leuk om te zien :).

introduction.body: You should be able to use the Simple Past correctly with regular words now. These are a few questions to see if you really get it!

content.body:
Fill in the correct form of the verb ''walking''.

to school yesterday
Heel goed!

It's okay - remember this:
infinitive + ed gives you:
walk + ed = walked :)

Fill in the correct form of the verb ''watching''.

We a very scary horrormovie last night.
You're doing great!

It's okay! Remember the basic rule:

infinitive+ed

watch + ed = watched! :)

Fill in the correct form of the word ''playing''.

Amanda hockey for years when she was younger!
Amazing!

It's okay :) Here you have the basic rule again:

infinitive + ed

play + ed = played! :)

Fill in the correct form of the word ''finishing''

She her homework at five o'clock yesterday.
Very good!

Remember the basic rule:

infinitive + ed

finish+ed = finished

Fill in the correct forms of the 3 verbs: arriving, practicing & testing.

We on planet practice, with the regular verbs and now we are about to get with the irregular verbs!
Now that's impressive! Good job!

Remember to just remove -ing to get the infinitive form. From there on you just add -ed!

arriv(ing) --> arriv + ed = arrived
practic(ing) --> practic + ed = practiced
test(ing)--> test + ed = tested

introduction.body: Welcome to the irregular verbs! I hope you did well with the regular ones. These ones are a bit harder but I am sure you can do it! Try to do this without peeking in your textbook - just to see which words you already know :). Goodluck!

content.body:
Fill in the correct form of the word ''going''.

They to the Philippines a million times in their childhood.
Very good! This was a hard one!
The correct answer was ''went''
Last week, when I was sick, my mom me a big bowl delicious chickensoup.
You're doing great!
The correct answer was ''brought''

Fill in the correct form of the word ''seeing''.

When we were in Dubai, we the highest building in the entire world.
Great job!
The correct answer was ''saw''.

Fill in the correct form of the word ''thinking''.

Before he made a decision, he about it for a very long time.
You're doing really well!
The correct answer was ''thought''.

Fill in the correct form of ''meeting'' and ''becoming''.

We eachother in 2015 and became immediately.
Very impressive! This was a hard one!
This was a sneaky one, it's okay! The correct answers were: ''met'' and ''became''.

header.title: The Simple Past: regular VS irregular verbs

introduction.body: Oh no.. here we go again. The battle between the regular verbs and irregular verbs continues. This is an exercise in which you have to use both regular verbs and irregular verbs, practice away!

content.body:
Fill in the correct form of the words ''taking'' and ''to be''.

The wedding of prince Harry and Megan Markle, which place in 2018, definately the wedding of the year.
You're starting to really get it! :)
The correct forms of the verbs were: ''took'' & ''was''.
He me yesterday and me whether I the Simple Past. I him, ofcourse I !
This one was very hard. I did that on purpose; this is more likely how you are going to get in in the test!

A tip here is to first select which words are regular verbs: called and asked

Then you only have to focus on the remember the correct form of the irregular verbs!
Repetition is key :)

Fill in the correct form of the verbs: coming, going and watching.

When I home from school, I straight into my PJ's and Netflix all day.
Great job!

Watch is a regular verb, so the only thing that happens to it is: adding -ed.
Watch+ed = watched

Coming & going are irregular verbs. When you use them in the past simple tense they become: came and went

Fill in the correct form of the verbs: ''to be'' & ''starting''.

Last year, when I sixteen years old, I my drivinglessons.
Heel erg goed!

To start is a regular verb: start+ed is started
Was comes from the verb ''to be'' and is irregular.

Fill in the correct form of the verb ''seeing,'' ''staring'' and ''going''.

When I the moon and the stars last night, I at them for hours before I to bed.
Great job!

To stare is a regular verb:

star(ing) becomes: star+ed = stared

To see & going are irregular verbs. In the simple past they become: saw & went

items.content:
Wauw, what a rollercoaster we had over there on planet practice. I hope you've had fun and that you're starting to get it! Now it's time to see how far we've come - remember: this is not your official test, it's just to help you see whether you're on the right track. Take the practice-test seriously, it's a very good indication of how your final test is going to look like!

Good luck :)

introduction.body: Welcome to the mock-test. This is a test in which all that we've learned comes back one more time. The first two exercises are to help you remember the material. Exercise number 3 is a good indication of how you're final test is going to look like! I truly believe you can do it, we've practiced a lot - good luck!!!

content.body:
Verb: talking

I to my doctor last week.
Good job!

Talking
Step 1: Remove -ing
--> Talk

Step 2: add -ed
--> Talk + ed

Verb: Messaging

My bestfriend and I for hours last night.
Very good!

Messaging

Step 1: remove -ing
--> messag

Step 2: add -ed
--> messaged

Verb: Believing

When I was younger, I in Santa Claus.
Good job!

Believing

Step 1: remove -ing
--> believ

Step 2: add -ed
--> believed

Verb: to be

My parents born in 1972.
Very good!

Remember with the verb to be:

I/He/She/It --> was
We/they --> were

Verbs: hearing & crying

When I the good news, I out of happiness.
Good job!
Take another look at the second row of irregular verbs in your textbook!

Verbs: flying & coming

The bird away as soon as I close to it.
You're doing great!
Take another look at the second row of irregular verbs in your textbook!

Two weeks ago, we (starting) this digital program to learn more about the Simple Past. We (joining) the ride and (landing) on planet explanation where Mrs Jane (explaining) to us how it all works. We (learning) a lot there!

After our adventure on planet explanation we (going) to planet practice. We first (sharing) tips and tricks with each other to get happier. When we (becoming) happier it was time to get into practising. Did you know that once you're more positive, you will do better on tests? Mr Marc and Mrs Jane (teaching)us about an old quote that says:

''She (believing) she (can), so she did''
You did quite a good job!
Take another look at the explanation video & the sharing tips board to help you :)

items.content:
Welcome back! I am sure you did a great job with the mock test!

Hier heb je wat om op een leuke manier, nóg meer te oefenen met the Simple Past! Je kunt zelf kiezen hoe je wilt oefenen, dus veel plezier! :)

  • The Simple Past - Regular verbs
  • The Simple Past - Irregular verbs

You are really going for it! Je krijgt hier regelmatige en onregelmatige werkwoorden door elkaar - een hele goede oefening voor de eindtoets!

The Simple Past - Regular & Irregular verbs

The Simple Past - Regular & Irregular verbs

Wauw, I can't believe our ride has almost come to an end. We've had such a great time! I have prepared one more thing for you; the final test. We've practised a lot, I am sure you can do it - remember what Marc and I told you? If you believe you can do it, you CAN do it!

So... for the last time: GOODLUCK!

introduction.body:
Welcome to the Final Test. This is your ultimate chance to show me what you've learned! With all that practice, I am sure you will do extremely well. Believe in yourself and lots of good luck!

*Wanneer je klaar bent, roep je de docente om je bewijs van deelname te laten zien en om je resultaat te noteren. Nogmaals, heel veel succes!

content.body:
The battle between the regular and irregular verbs..

Long long time ago, in a land very far from here, there (to be) two planets: planet regular and planet irregular. The populations used to have good relationships, they (sharing) sentences and even (to hang out) out with the stars in the sky! Until one day, February 3rd 1766, a conflict (happened) between the nations. Someone from planet regular (wanting) to make life easier and wanted t0 have ONLY regular verbs in the universe. This would mean that planet irregular had to vanish and of course - they would not let this happen.

In April of the same year, the irregulars came with a proposal: they (promising) to make a song of the irregular verbs to make it easier for the inhabitants of the rest of the universe to remember them.

The regular verbs (thinking) this was the most terrible idea ever until... they (hearing) the song. It (hypnotizing) them into thinking it wasn't that bad! The regulars (starting) blasting the song through the whole milkyway until everyone knew who the irregulare verbs were.

And from that day my friends, the irregular verbs have been able to stay around forever:

They (living), they (fighting), they (surviving).
Watch the explanation video again for a Recap :)

items.content:
You thought this was the end of the ride huh? You really thought that after all the hard work you wouldn't even get a reward? I've written something for you - and I hope you will like it :)

Life is simple

Don't make it hard

You will have challenges

You will have good times

Take notes of both

You will be fine

Work hard

Because hard work brings you far

See you in few years

You'll be rising like a star :)

*I hope that it motivates you and that you will keep working hard on achieving the things you want. Believe in yourself; because if you believe, you shall recieve! I hope to see you soon again!

Ms. Jane out

Zo, dat was me toch een rit. Ik hoop dat je het leuk hebt gehad met Mrs Jane! Ik zei toch dat ze goed was :). Nu ben je een echte pro op het gebied van the past simple! Het is tijd voor de volgende stap. Hieronder vind je een link naar het programma van Juf Dina, waar je te maken gaat krijgen met the present perfect tense. En weetje wat? Ik denk dat je het daar net zo goed zal doen! It's time to go now, heel veel succes and I hope to see you soon!

Ms. Dounia

LINK NAAR JUF DINA'S PROGRAMMA:

https://maken.wikiwijs.nl/137720/Present_Perfect_Tense#!page-4993033
